free_text.Learning outcomes: The course will include the basic knowledge of the classical non-destructive testing methods as they are used today in industrial applications, before moving on to cover advanced (mostly imaging) technologies used for the analysis of materials and components in special applications. The content covers several material groups (metals, polymers, ceramics, building materials) and applications (mechanical and civil engineering, air and space, electronics).
free_text.Content: The course content is as follows:[br/][br/][li] Probability of detection / human factors[br/][li] Visual, optical and thermal methods[br/][li] Penetrant and leak testing[br/][li] Electromagnetic methods: diverted magnetic flux, eddy current, microwaves[br/][li] Acoustic methods: ultrasonics, acoustic emission[br/][li] Radiography, radioscopy, computed tomography[br/][li] Magnetic resonance imaging
free_text.Keywords: Radiography, Radioscopy, Computed Tomography, Ultrasonic Emission, Acoustic Emission, Electromagnetic methods.
